source.9a192431:
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeClassifier
import joblib ##this joblib object has methods for saving and loading models.
source.65308cd8:
music_data = pd.read_excel("../input/music-dataset/Music_Purchase_Data.xlsx")
X = music_data.drop(columns=['genre'])
y = music_data['genre']

model = DecisionTreeClassifier()
model.fit(X, y)
source.a1a9416d: joblib.dump(model, "music-recommender.joblib")#dumping the model in joblib file for future use.
source.0968e44e: model = joblib.load('music-recommender.joblib') #just check it out the joblib file in "output: kaggle/working" directory.
source.3b857bbb: * **After we tain our model we simply call joblib.dump and give it two aurguments (our_model, 'name of the file which we want to store this model')**
